metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9628 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The XMLTooling library all versions prior to V3.0.4, provided with the OpenSAML and Shibboleth Service Provider software, contains an XML parsing class. Invalid data in the XML declaration causes an exception of a type that was not handled properly in the parser class and propagates an unexpected exception type.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9628` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxmltooling6 - 1.5.3-2+deb8u3ubuntu0.1
xmltooling-schemas - 1.5.3-2+deb8u3ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xmltooling package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.5.3-2+deb8u3ubuntu0.1').
